title: Textile With Chef De Piece, "Dianne Chasseresse", ca. 1798
medium:
Medium: plain weave cotton
Technique: printed by engraved plate (the short height of the repeat indicates that the shorter printing plate which came into use at the turn on the century was used; original glaze is visible)
inscribed: Stamp at one end bearing the mark of the Oberkampf factory in use from 1792 to 1815. Also: N.3 in a box, 'M' in Italic script, LLC in a box and 275 (abraded). On other side of cloth are more marks: 14, I(2)M, 4(10)2, 5586 crossed out 2 3 (unreadable), and either 18 or 81.
provenance: Formenrly in the collection of Elinor Merrell where it was No. 5 on her list of chefs de piece.
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 177 x 101.5 cm (5 ft. 9 11/16 in. x 39 15/16 in.)
Repeat H: 53.5 cm (21 1/16 in.)
W (printing surface): 92 cm (36 1/4 in.)
description: Design in brown on white background. Figure of Diana as a huntress with various classical medallions.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile With Chef De Piece, "Dianne Chasseresse", ca. 1798.Medium: plain weave cotton
Technique: printed by engraved plate (the short height of the repeat indicates that the shorter printing plate which came into use at the turn on the century was used; original glaze is visible). Gift of Cora Ginsburg. 1994-80-5.
